title: First Stop: Contact
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 3%] Not long after first embarking, the vehicle seems to have pulled in. Although this doesn’t feel familiar yet, things should change after a fight or three.

title: Station #2: Restoration
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 8%] They are things that we’ve met at one point. This may be another such encounter. Or, they might be beings that we will meet at some point.

title: Station #3: Sinkage
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 13%] A sorrowful and gloomy cry is heard. As tempting as it is to stick around and hear its cry, we can’t stay for too long. To reach the next station, there’s no choice but to face it.

title: Station #4: Reunion
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 19%] Those are the ones that relentlessly chased us once before. Seeing them confront us yet again… Why, it could almost make me sick.

title: Station #5: Insulation
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 23%] Roaring thunder shakes the air. Occasionally, the darkness is pierced by a purple bolt of lightning. The sound grows closer. The lights glow brighter. It becomes clear what awaits us.

title: Station #6: Pickup
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 34%] It seems the thunderous hums still linger. No, that’s incorrect. The sound is similar but not quite the same. The scent of rust stains and burnt meat brushed past us.

title: Station #7: Headlessness
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 42%] Many reflections and refractions were suffered. Vertigo induces the urge to tear my head off. Managing to hold in the impossible impulse to vomit, a being came into sight that made me glad that my urge stopped as a mere thought.

title: Station #8: Existence
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 51%] Those corporate drones weren’t the only beasts known for regeneration. Looking back… there was also a being that took from what it fought. It would mimic them as its own. A being that covered its existence in what belonged to others.

title: Station #9: Serum
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 59%] The logo of a corporation that once cornered us can be seen. Those who would heal their scrapes the instant they were inflicted… This will require some determination.

title: Station #10: Forked Tongue
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 71%] The slithering tongue is split into two. Unsure of which direction to point, it nervously extends and retracts. Both we and it are in peril. One wrong choice could mean being reflected off this plane.

title: Station #11: Energization
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 84%] Those are beings that we saw several stations ago. Why they are together in one place is a complete mystery. Perhaps they were cast into the same location when they were refracted. Or, they might have joined together as naturally as water conducts electricity.

title: Station #12: Purity
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 92%] It stood there, taking the form it believed to be purest. One Sinner exclaimed that this couldn’t be possible, but in a world as warped and twisted as this, such a statement wouldn’t travel far. The only exchange allowed was that of blows—dealt with weapons and arms.

title: Last Stop: Non-self
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 99%] This is the limit. Even a short rest feels like it might eject us back to whence we came. A single moment’s carelessness can bring all our effort to naught. If we make it through this, we will be able to reach the terminus. Let’s empty our minds and proceed—as if nothing were ever there.

title: First Stop: Curse
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 0%] Here we go again. Memories of painful battles we've endured, the odd feeling of refraction pierces through my body. I wonder if we can adapt once more.

title: Station #2: Servitude
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 14%] It was working ceaselessly. The machine has never stopped working since its pressurized, scalding hot steam turned its first gears. We must break the cycle in which it has long been trapped to continue on our path.

title: Station #3: Rainfall
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 21%] The fox cries, sometimes. We know not if it cries for sorrow or rain. We know, however, that the umbrellas piercing its body are not there for the rain. For the fox has not once opened them for itself.

title: Station #4: Arrears
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 37%] You know what they say: time is money. I've once heard the tale of a miser who amasses a hoard of gold deep within his basement. Amassing time as one does gold is not so different, perhaps. ... Their clocks are giving me a headache for some reason.

title: Station #5: The Lure
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 49%] The refraction rate rises steeply in this train. Every single Station feels like a mountain to climb. I think we can take a short rest by the stocky tree stump and the forest with the blue lights... The teal—colored light atop the branch dances from side to side, beckoning us...

title: Station #6: Exploitation
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 63%] We must sometimes become selfish things, full of animosity if it means our survival. Sometimes, we make others suffer so that we may not. For a moment, I hesitate before the two buttons in front of the Station. Am I doing the right thing...?

title: Station #7: Odd Stench
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 86%] 'Come here, come all! Take a swig!' I can smell the unpleasant stench of alcohol even before the Train door opens. 'Hurry along, all! A big swill, and you'll feel swell!' ... It doesn't even look remotely look potable. One of the Sinners begins to retch violently. Guess I'm not alone in thinking that.

title: Station #8: Cycle
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 96%] The train awaits our choice. The refraction rate is at its limits. Breach past it, or... Ricochet off and start a new Cycle? Whichever it is, we must choose carefully. We want to avoid falling off into a wayward path like that... thing outside the Station.

title: Station #4: Arrears
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 37%] You know what they say: time is money. I've once heard the tale of a miser who amasses a hoard of gold deep within his basement. Amassing time as one does gold is not so different, perhaps. ... Their clocks are giving me a headache for some reason.

title: Station #7: Odd Stench
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: 86%] 'Come here, come all! Take a swig!' I can smell the unpleasant stench of alcohol even before the Train door opens. 'Hurry along, all! A big swill, and you'll feel swell!' ... It doesn't even look remotely potable. One of the Sinners begins to retch. Guess I'm not alone there.

title: Terminus: The Garden
desc: [REFRACTION RATE: ∞%] The true Terminus. This is an adequate place to get off this train without getting lost. The refraction rate is already off the charts. For the first time since we embarked on this journey... I see a signpost. Maybe, this is where this railway line ends. Or maybe… this is where we meet our ends.

title: First Stop: Cogwheel
desc: [Refraction Rate: 0%] I can hear the metal cogwheels turning and creaking. Something heavy and massive seems to be taking a step with every teeth that click into each other.

title: Station #2: Waves
desc: [Refraction Rate: 14%] An opaque, shimmering wave crashes unto us. Perhaps its countless emotions, all of it lodged into its back, is reminiscent of that shimmering. Silently yet ponderously, it crashes unto us.

title: Station #3: Nostalgia
desc: [Refraction Rate: 28%] A nostalgic sight appears before us. The scene seems to beckon us—perhaps it brings out in us a faint remembrance of the past. Some Sinners appear rather distraught… This time, we’ll have to approach it with our weapons drawn.

title: Station #4: Interlude
desc: [Refraction Rate: ??%] A heavy noise echoes once. The teeth on the cogwheel click into one another—tick, tock, then it comes to a stop with a heavy grating noise. The cogs will begin to turn again as soon as we exit this place. Let’s prepare ourselves before moving to the next stop.

title: Station #5: Drudgery
desc: [Refraction Rate: 39%] We’ve gone through this salty scent of the sea before. The one who painfully bears the multitude of filth, salt, and other similar things within it awaits us there.

title: Station #6: Truth
desc: [Refraction Rate: 51%] An odd, miasmatic scent of a burning candle fills this place. In it is the one who seeks the truth. Its massive eyes roll about to capture every little detail and knowledge. It would be best that we stop it from consuming more knowledge before the flames of truth begin burning.

title: Station #7: Eclosion
desc: [Refraction Rate: 66%] The heat from the flaming sunset can be felt all the way from here. A mere brush against its flames will burn everything to ashes, but its fiery embrace may be a warmth that cannot be found anywhere else. The potential, born again from the flames, gently beckons us.

title: Station #8: Interlude
desc: [Refraction Rate: ??%] A heavy noise echoes once. The teeth on the cogwheel click into one another—tick, tock, then it comes to a stop with a heavy grating noise. The cogs will begin to turn again as soon as we exit this place. Let’s prepare ourselves before moving to the next stop.

title: Station #9: Pallidification
desc: [Refraction Rate: 14%] They crawl down and appear before us, those whose hearts were painted over. They are pallid, whiter than white. What were their colors before something painted over them and turned them into empty canvases?

title: Station #10: Brainwash
desc: [Refraction Rate: 83%] If there are those whose hearts are painted, then there is one who paints hearts. When the train comes to a stop, I can see from a distance a confident figure. She is flanked by her followers. She stands as though to greet us, to paint over our hearts as well. Then we will meet her with our weapons drawn.

title: Station #11: Gaslight
desc: [Refraction Rate: 89%] I thought we had defeated her in the previous Station, but… The one who paints hearts had only grown even more hideous. She is no longer flanked by her followers, yet… it feels as though they are now within her. We mustn’t let ourselves be distracted by the flickering, dancing flames on her weapon arm. Focus on her instead.

title: Station #12: Interlude
desc: [Refraction Rate: ??%] A heavy noise echoes once. The teeth on the cogwheel click into one another—tick, tock, then it comes to a stop with a heavy grating noise. The cogs will begin to turn again as soon as we exit this place. Let’s prepare ourselves before moving to the next stop.

title: Terminus: Spiral
desc: [Refraction Rate: 99%] We emerge from the long tunnel and arrive at the Terminus; there lies the land of gold. I can hear an odd, metallic noise echoing from the distance. It’s not the kind of metallic noise that makes one shudder, but the sound digs deep under our skin. We have to finish this fight before this twisted and formless sensation scrambles our brains.
